intro: Tropidocarpum capparideum, commonly known as the Capparis-like spurge, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny stems and leaves that are typically alternate and ovate in shape. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are usually yellow or greenish in color, followed by capsule fruits containing numerous seeds. It is native to parts of Africa and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations, it is of interest to botanists and horticulturists alike.
